feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: CDS not found - SAP CAPM deployment failing resulting in server crash
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

You kindly helped Syed to resolve this issue https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/sap-cap-multi-tenant-app-deployment-failing-cds-not-found/qaq-p/13751344. Apologies for creating a new ticket as I dont know how to continue discussion on same ticket. Again apologies.

Similar to Syed, I am also trying to deploy SAP CAP Multi-tenant application, while deploying the app my app got crashed with error as ERR sh:1:cds:not found and some other errors. I have attached server error, package.json and mta.yaml file.

PS: I have added "start": "cds-serve" and "@sap/cds-dk": "^9" in my package.json and ran npm i -g @sap/cds-dk & npm install -g npm@11.4.2 from SAP BAS tool using terminal under folder /home/user/projects/vivekcapm

@Willem_Pardaens can you please guide me ?

Regards,
Vivek

entry.title: SAP CAP MTA - Dynamic Property Value
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have a CAP application and we want to inject dynamically the value of one of the properties in the MTA file depending on the environment. This info could be stored as a environment variable bound to the app or even in a user provided service.

Can this be achieved at all?

Not able to find any clear guidance on this.

Thanks,

C.

entry.title: CDS watch fails in Business application studio.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am using BAS to create a CAPM application on Node.js. However, when I perform "cds watch", it gives following error. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
ERROR: Package '@sap/cds' was loaded from different installations: [
  '/home/user/projects/sample_app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js',
  '/extbin/globals/pnpm/5/.pnpm/@sap+cds@9.1.0_@eslint+js@9.30.1_express@4.21.2/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js'
] 
Ensure a single install to avoid hard-to-resolve errors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

My package.json looks as follows

{
  "name": "Sample_App",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "repository": "<Add your repository here>",
  "license": "UNLICENSED",
  "private": true,
  "devDependencies": {
    "@sap/ux-specification": "^1.120.8",
    "rimraf": "^5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve",
    "watch-reassure": "cds watch --open uimodule/webapp/index.html?sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false",
    "undeploy": "cf undeploy Sample_App --delete-services --delete-service-keys --delete-service-brokers",
    "build": "rimraf resources mta_archives && mbt build --mtar archive",
    "deploy": "cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar --retries 1"
  },
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "db": {
        "kind": "hana"
      },
      "uaa": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      },
      "[production]": {
        "db": {
          "kind": "hana-cloud"
        },
        "auth": {
          "kind": "xsuaa"
        },
        "approuter": {
          "kind": "cloudfoundry"
        }
      },
      "auth": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      }
    },
    "cov2ap": {
      "plugin": true,
      "path": "v2"
    },
    "hana": {
      "deploy-format": "hdbtable"
    }
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js-community/odata-v2-adapter": "^1.15.2",
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4",
    "express": "^4",
    "jwt-decode": "^4",
    "sap-cf-axios": "^1.0.2"
  }
}

 

cds -v gives

-js/asyncapi: 1.0.3
@cap-js/db-service: 2.2.0
@cap-js/hana: 2.1.1
@cap-js/openapi: 1.2.3
@sap/cds: 9.1.0
@sap/cds-compiler: 6.1.0
@sap/cds-dk: 9.1.1
@sap/cds-dk (global): 9.0.6
@sap/cds-fiori: 2.0.1
@sap/cds-mtxs: 3.1.0
Sample_App: 1.0.0
Node.js: v22.13.1

 

npm ls -g gives

/home/user/.node_modules_global/lib
└── (empty)

 

Have tried installing @SAP/cds@9.0.6 to no avail. Kindly guide.

 

Regards,

Akshay

SAP Business Application Studio SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Node.js

entry.title: SAP CAP Service with Managed Router
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Since the begining of the days with CAP, we have always used standalone app router and we are wondering if we should be using a managed app router instead as we are doing with most of our UI5 apps.

The app router documentation for UI5 apps is quite well documented but no so clear when it comes to SAP CAP.

What is it required for a CAP service to use a managed app router?

If we do not include an app router in our MTA, is our service by default going to use a managed app router? If so, is there any kind of pre-requisite (subaccount needs to have SAP WZ, SAP CAP should include presentation layer)?

Many thanks in advance.

Regards,

C.

entry.title: Entity Creation from Fiori Elements Extension
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm currently experiencing an issue while upgrading an app from CAP v7 to CAP v8, hoping I can get some advice. This application has a parent and child entity (a 1 to many composition), like below:

entity Deliveries: managed, cuid {
  deliveryField1: String(10);
  deliveryField2: String(10);
  pallets: Composition of many Pallets on pallets.delivery = $self;
}

entity Pallets: managed, cuid {
  palletField1: String(10);
  palletField2: String(10);
  delivery: Association to one Deliveries;
}

The service definition is straightforward:

.draft.enabled
entity Deliveries as projection on db.Deliveries;

@cds.redirection.target
entity Pallets as projection on db.Pallets;

The UI of this is a custom Fiori elements table where for example you can assign multiple pallets to a delivery at once. In the custom UI5 logic, once the relevant items are chosen, they are created in the CAP backend like this:

const oPalletTable = this.getView().byId("fe::CustomSubSection::Pallets--PalletTable");
const oBinding = oPalletTable.getBinding("items");
const pallet = oBinding.create({
  palletField1: 'val1',
  palletField2: 'val2',
});
await pallet.created();

Which initiates a post OData call to /Deliveries(ID=xxx,IsActiveEntity=false)/pallets

This setup worked fine in CAP v7. After upgrading to CAP v8 however, the create call still initiates but the fields (e.g. palletField1 and palletField2 in this example) are being stripped out by the CAP backend and a blank entity is being created (the generated IDs and draft administrative data is present, but the field values passed from the frontend are blank).

I say the fields are being stripped out by the backend because when I debug the service handler (this.on("CREATE", Pallets.drafts, async (req, next) => {), in req.data the fields are blank, however if I look at req.http.req.body this shows the raw HTTP request and the fields are populated. So the field values are making it to the CAP backend, however they do not make it into req.data.

Any advice or guidance would be appreciated. I'm not sure whether this is the correct way to create entities programmatically from UI5 however it did work for CAP v7 or if it something related to the entity or service definition.

Regards,
Tim

entry.title: HDI access on Database explorer for CAP services
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Developers used to access HDI containers part of CAP services over Database Explorer. For this, they only thing required is to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role developers in the space where the HDI is deployed. 

Now, we do not want to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role to developers but we still would like to grant access to developers to the HDI over the Database explorer. How can we achieve this?

Note that we may not want to grant write permission to developers so we may not want to assign directly the HDI:access:role to users.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: Issues with SAP Business Hub REST API consumption in CAP App
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a scenario, where I need to fetch all data from OMF Product API which is available in SAP Business Acclerator Hub as a REST service.

Overview | Products | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

When I import the JSON/YAML service as directed in all CAP guides, it is imported. But there is no entity definition.

My objective is to fetch all the records with $top and $skip and show it in a simple CAP List View app without storing it in persistence storage (Like HANA Cloud). 

Can you provide a guide or help on how I can achieve it? I have done it through the REST Proxy method but it is failing to get a large set of data and getting timeout.

DB Schema

entity Product {
  key id                          : UUID;
      displayId                   : String;
      externalSystemReferences    : String;
      name                        : String;
      productType                 : String;
      description                 : String;
      published                   : Boolean;
      replicationType             : String;
      soldElectronically          : Boolean;
      markedForDeletion           : Boolean;
      activeMarketIds             : String;
      aspectId                    : String;
      baseUnitOfMeasure           : String;
      physicalProductCategory     : String;
      physicalProductGroup        : String;
      physicalProductItemCategory : String;
      physicalProductType         : String;
      salesAreaData               : String;
      unitOfMeasures              : String;
}

 SERVICE.JS

const { default: cds } = require("@sap/cds");

module.exports = cds.service.impl(async function () {
    const {
        Product
    } = this.entities;
    var firstRead = true;
    this.before('READ', Product, async (req) => {
        try {
            if (firstRead) {
                var recfound = 0;
                var pageNumber = 0; 
                var pageSize = req.query.SELECT.limit.rows.val;
                do {
                    const sapOmf = await cds.connect.to('sapOmfProductApi');
                    const resp = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products?pageNumber=' + pageNumber); // + "&pageSize=" + pageSize);
                    const products = resp;
                    const entries = [];
                    //products.forEach(product => {
                    for (const product of products) {
                        const extSystem = product.externalSystemReferences;
                        let extSysText = '';
                        if (extSystem) {
                            extSystem.forEach(es => {
                                extSysText += es.externalId + '-' + es.externalSystemId + ",";
                            });
                        }

                        const prodDetail = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products/' + product.id);
                        const amkid = prodDetail.activeMarketIds;
                        const salesArea = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.salesAreaData;
                        const uom = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.unitOfMeasures;
                        let mktext = '';
                        if (amkid) {
                            amkid.forEach(mk => {
                                mktext += mk + '-';
                            });
                        }
                        let satext = '';
                        if (salesArea) {
                            salesArea.forEach(area => {
                                satext += 'Active:' + area.active + '-' + 'Distribution Channel:' + area.distributionChannel + '-' +
                                    'Division:' + area.division + '-' + 'Pricing Ref Product:' + area.pricingReferenceProduct + '-' +
                                    'Product Pricing Group:' + area.productPricingGroup + '-' + 'Sales Org:' + area.salesOrganization + ',';
                            });
                        }

                        let uomtext = '';
                        if (uom) {
                            uom.forEach(um => {
                                uomtext += um.alternativeUnitOfMeasure + '-' + um.numerator + '-' + um.denominator + ',';
                            });
                        }
                        entries.push({
                            id: product.id,
                            displayId: product.displayId,
                            externalSystemReferences: extSysText,
                            name: product.name,
                            productType: product.productType,
                            description: product.description,
                            published: product.published,
                            replicationType: product.replicationType,
                            soldElectronically: product.soldElectronically,
                            markedForDeletion: product.markedForDeletion,
                            activeMarketIds: mktext,
                            salesAreaData: satext,
                            unitOfMeasures: uomtext,
                            aspectId: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.aspectId,
                            baseUnitOfMeasure: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.baseUnitOfMeasure,
                            physicalProductType: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductType,
                            physicalProductItemCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductItemCategory,
                            physicalProductCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductCategory,
                            physicalProductGroup: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductGroup
                        });
                    }
                    // delete all countries

                    await cds.tx(req).run(INSERT.into(Product).entries(entries));
                    firstRead = false;
                    pageNumber++;
                    recfound = entries.length;

                } while (recfound > 0);
                return req;
            }
        } catch (err) {
            req.error(500, err.message);
        }
    });
});

This is using a schema and trying to insert data in that DB table every time. I am sure this not the best method and for large set of data it is not working. Please let me know the best way and how I can fetch data in bunch like 30 records at a time.

entry.title: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently developing an application with the following components:

- CAP backend,

- FE Frontend

- Several SAPUI5 (Freestyle) Frontends

Up until now I have only used auth: mocked or dummy. This way, the connections between front- and backend have worked seamlessly. Now, after having deployed my SAPUI5 frontends to the HTML5 repo and trying to do POST requests against the backend I get a 403 - forbidden response (works however in BAS dev env and Postman) - also the GET requests from the very same SAPUI5 Apps work. I have done some research on this and most articles were suggesting CORS / CSRF issues but I also read that this is handled automatically by the SAPUI5 Framework. Further research suggested that deployed apps require proper token based authentication, which is why I am trying to setup XSUAA now. However, I am having a hard time wrapping my head around this as to what is exactly required for my frontends, backend, managed approuter,..etc.. Thus, I am asking you for some guidance regarding these topics / my issue. 

Regards,

Oliver

entry.title: What causes a CAP projection on a DB entity to fail after accessing an external OData V2 service?
entry.content:
I have a CAP Node.js project that exposes a single service containing both:

  • Projections on local database tables

  • Projections on an external OData V2 service (via EDMX)

service BookingService {
  entity BookingStatuses as projection on my.db.ValueHelp;
  entity HCMBookingRequestView as projection on External.RequestViewSet
     {
      ..
      ..
      code,
      status: Association to ValueHelps on ValueHelps.code= code
     }
  }

What is happening?

  •  I first access BookingService/BookingStatuses → works fine.

  • Then I access BookingService/HCMBookingRequestView → also works.

  •  Then I again access BookingService/BookingStatuses → Fails with:

    Error: Target BookingService.BookingStatuses cannot be resolved for service SAP_HCM

What could be causing this?

  • What makes CAP think that BookingStatuses belongs to the SAP_HCM external service?

  • How is service context resolution managed internally in CAP when both local and remote projections are used in the same service?

  • What should I check to prevent CAP from mixing up DB and external projections?

  • How can I isolate or reset the context so that local projections are always correctly resolved?

  • What’s the best practice for mixing projections on DB and remote services in the same CAP service?

Setup Details

  • CAP version: @SAP/cds 8.9.4

  • External service: SAP_HCM (OData V2, connected via EDMX + destination)

  • Local DB: SQLite (dev), HANA (prod)

Any help or guidance on how to resolve this or how to structure services to avoid this would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Add @sap/cds v8 service to existing project that uses v7 using existing db
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to add a new UI5 application using odata v4 and an Analytical Table to our current mta application using @SAP/cds v7. 
The Analytical Table sends queries that could only be processed with  @SAP/cds v8 service, v7 gives errors like Feature is not supported: Transformation "CONCAT" with query option $apply
I would like to use the db of the existing mta application for that new service.

 Do you have any suggestion?

I have some ideas but struggling with both:

  • adding the new service to the current mta app
    • upgrading @SAP/cds - there's a lot of custom code to rewrite, not ideal
    • adding the new v8 service without upgrading @SAP/cds in the whole project, having a package.json in the new service folder with @SAP/cds v8 - not tried that yet, just came into my mind
  • creating a new app using the existing db
    • define the current db as existing service - I cannot make the xsuaa to work so far
    •  consume the existing hdi container - all the examples I found using schema name and role, but I see no option defining those for the hdi container
      e.g. https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-consume-existing-database-container-in-sap-cloud-application/ba-p/13559865
      https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hana-cloud-access-cross-container-schema.html

 Any help would be appreciated.

Best,
Peter

entry.title: cds.context.headers not updating from req.headers in CAP v9
entry.content:
We’re upgrading a CAP application from version 7.9 to 9 and noticed that cds.context.headers no longer reflects values from req.headers, which used to work in the older version.

In version 7.9, cds.context.headers was automatically populated from the request headers. After the upgrade to v9, this no longer happens — it stays empty or outdated.

Was this behavior removed in a specific version after 7.9, or is it a bug?

Behavior comparison:

  • Version 7.9:

  • Version 9:

    •  

Any ideas if this is an intentional change or something we’re missing? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Stream with CAP Node JS
entry.content:
Hello,
I've implemented a very simplistic CAP service that sends a request to a SAP S4 backend system to retrieve a file as a stream ( .../$value)

This a simplified version of my code in the request handler function :

const results = await _sendAxiosHttpRequest(
            {
                method: "GET",
                url: "<service_path>/$value",
                headers: oHeaders,
                responseType: "stream",
                maxContentLength: Infinity,
                maxBodyLength: Infinity
            },
            <my_destination>);
    
 return [{ value: results.data,
           $mediaContentType: results.headers["content-type"],
           $mediaContentDispositionType: results.headers["content-disposition"] }];

As you can see, i send the request using Axios and in debug mode I checked that this request to the S/4 backend is successful.
results.data is an object of type IncomingMessage (which is a readable stream)
The problem is that the response generated by the CAP service contains nothing. It returns an empty response. 
Even the headers "content-type" and "content-disposition" are not set.

Do you have any Idea, why it's not working ?

Thank you for your help 🙂

entry.title: Learning SAP BTP CAP Application
entry.content:
Hello,

I’m new to the SAP ecosystem and find it quite promising so far. My background is in traditional Java and JavaScript-based applications, and I also have experience with deployment processes.

Recently, I started exploring the SAP BTP Free Tier and attempted to develop a CAP (Cloud Application Programming) application. However, I’ve been facing some difficulties—especially with the official learning journeys and free resources, which I find hard to follow or insufficiently detailed.

My goal is to build and deploy a full-stack CAP application, and I’m looking for comprehensive, beginner-friendly guides or tutorials that can walk me through this journey from scratch. I would prefer resources that explain the core concepts thoroughly rather than just relying on plugins or auto-generated code. I want to understand and write the code myself, so I can confidently customize and maintain it later.

Additionally, I’m interested in learning SAP Fiori to build the front-end/UI for my CAP applications. However, I notice that most examples and tools auto-generate Fiori elements, which I find limiting for deeper learning.

Could you suggest:

  • The best step-by-step resources (courses, tutorials, documentation)?

  • A clear learning roadmap for mastering CAP and Fiori from scratch?

  • How to navigate or explore these tools and concepts effectively?

Any guidance or structured approach would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser’s back button or the Launchpad’s NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn’t change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here’s how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We’ve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Facing CDS Compiler version issue in SAP CAP Java
entry.content:
Hello,

I am working on SAP CAP Java. had to upgrade version on only axios in package.json file. it also upgrades cds-compiler version to 6.1.0 in my package-lock.json file and now service fails saying 'CDS compiler version 6 is not supported. Please use cds-dk 8 w/ cds-compiler 5'.

I have even upgraded to the latest
@SAP/cds from 8.8.0 to 9.2.0,
@SAP/cds-dk from 8.8.0 to 9.2.0,
cds-compiler from 4.9.0 to 6.1.0.

still facing this issue in my service. except downgrading is there any other way?,  can someone help me out?

entry.title: REST APIs are working fine But my Service.js implmentations are not triggering when app is deployed
entry.content:
Hi guys i have a requirement when i have use react as an app in CAP project. Where i have done that and working fine in local development. But when i deploy using manifest.yml 

where i want only service to be as separate application so i have build data using CDS BUILD --PRODUCTION for deployment.

When deployement is done i wasnt able to call my action and function which are implemented in Service.js . 

i am repeating again everything is working fine in the local development. and i would deploy React app as static_buildpack as separate applicaiton and use this service of app there.

Is there anything i have missed?

Thanks & Regards

entry.title: Call Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application using oAuth2 authentication
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Does anyone have a resource/blog which will guide for accessing a Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application by using oAuth2 authentication method. Previously the approach was to use Username and Password, but that is being deprecated.

So to move towards the oAuth2 related authentication, i would like to know the steps that needs to be taken from SF admin center and also the steps needs to implemented in a CAP application to access this API based on this oAuth2 credentials. Kindly help. Thanks.

@qmacro : Kindly extend your help. Thanks.

entry.title: To set up a destination in SAP BTP for connecting to the Microsoft Azure Mail Service -Graph API
entry.content:
1. Access SAP BTP Cockpit 

  • Log into SAP BTP Cockpit: Go to SAP BTP Cockpit 
  • Navigate to Subaccount: In the subaccount of your choice (where the destination will be configured), click on the subaccount to access its settings.

2. Create a New Destination

  • Navigate to Destinations:

    • In the SAP BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations (under the Connectivity section in your subaccount).

    • Create New Destination:

      • Click + (Create New Destination).

      • Fill in the following fields:

3. Configure the Destination for Microsoft Graph API

     Fill in the required fields to define the destination for Microsoft Graph API:

     General Information

  • Name: Choose a descriptive name for the destination, e.g., AzureMailService.

  • Type: Select HTTP.

  • Description: Provide a brief description, e.g., "Destination for Microsoft Graph API to send transactional emails."

  • URL:  https://graph.microsoft.com/V1.0

4. Authentication Settings

  • Authentication:

    • Select OAuth2 for OAuth authentication, since Microsoft Graph API requires OAuth2 Client Credentials flow.

    • OAuth2 Client Credentials: This will be your method for obtaining access tokens to authenticate API requests.

      • OAuth2 Client ID: This is the Client ID from the Azure AD app you registered in the Azure portal.

      • OAuth2 Client Secret: This is the Client Secret generated for the Azure AD app.

      • OAuth2 Token URL: The token URL from Microsoft Identity Platform, which is:

         
        https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenantId}/oauth2/v2.0/token

        Replace {tenantId} with your actual tenant ID.

      • OAuth2 Scope: For sending emails, use the scope Mail.Send. This allows the app to send emails through Microsoft Graph API.

      • OAuth2 Grant Type: Choose Client Credentials as you're using the client credentials flow.

5.Connection Settings

  • URL: Set the URL to connect to Microsoft Graph API. The base URL for Microsoft Graph is:

     
    https://graph.microsoft.com

  • Proxy Type: If you are using a proxy, you can set it here. If not, leave it as None.

  • Additional Headers: You can add any extra headers if needed. Usually, for Microsoft Graph API, no additional headers are required apart from the authorization header, which is handled automatically by the OAuth2 configuration.

6. Test the Destination

  • Test Connectivity: After creating the destination, test it by clicking on Check Connection.

  • Successful Connection: If the connection is successful, you’ll see a message confirming that the destination is reachable.

7. Secure the Destination

  • Security Considerations:

    • Make sure that only authorized users and applications have access to this destination.

    • You can use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to limit who can access this destination in SAP BTP.

8. Integrate the Destination into Your Application

Once the destination is configured, you can integrate it into your Node.js or CAPM application to use it for sending emails.

  • Access Destination Programmatically:

    const { retrieveJwt } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity');
    const { executeHttpRequest } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client');
    module.exports = srv => {
      srv.on('sendmail', async (req) => {
            const JWT_Token = retrieveJwt(req);    // Access the destination via JWT Secured token
        const destination = {
          destinationName: 'AzureMailService', JWT_Token
         };
      }
    }

Use Destination in API Requests: Use the executeHttpRequest method from the SAP Cloud SDK to make requests to the Microsoft Graph API, passing in the destination to authenticate the request.

Conclusion

By setting up a destination for the Microsoft Azure Mail Service in SAP BTP, you establish a secure and centralized way for your SAP applications to send transactional emails via the Microsoft Graph API. This eliminates the need for third-party email services, reduces costs, and ensures a reliable and scalable email service across your BTP landscape.
